Package ohos.media.player

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.media.player.Player

  • public class Player
extends Object
    Controls audio and video playback.

    A Player instance can play or loop one or more media files. Example code: 

     try (FileInputStream in = new FileInputStream(new File(PLAYER_TEST_FILE))) {
     FileDescriptor fd = in.getFD();
     Source source = new Source(fd);
     Player impl = new Player();
     impl.setSource(source);
     impl.prepare();
     impl.play();
 } catch (IOException e) {
     // ...
 }
    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Multimedia#MEDIA

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Player.AudioHandler
      Enumerates handling modes for audio parameters whose values are out of common ranges.
      static class  Player.DeviceInfo
      Provides information about a device that plays an audio or video file.
      static interface  Player.IPlayerCallback
      Provides media player callbacks upon completion of playback, playback position changes, and video size changes.
      static class  Player.MediaTimedMetaData
      Represents media timed metadata.
      static class  Player.MediaTimeInfo
      Represents media time information.
      static class  Player.StreamInfo
      Provides descriptions of the media stream metadata contained in media files.

      • VIDEO_SCALE_TYPE_CROP

        public static final int VIDEO_SCALE_TYPE_CROP
        Indicates that the aspect ratio of the video remains unchanged.

        If the aspect ratio of the video differs from that of the surface, the video will be cropped to fit the surface.

        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VIDEO_SCALE_TYPE_FIT

        public static final int VIDEO_SCALE_TYPE_FIT
        Indicates that the video is stretched in the rendering surface.

        If the aspect ratio of the video differs from that of the surface, the original aspect ratio will not be retained during video rendering.

        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • setSurfaceOps

        public boolean setSurfaceOps​(SurfaceOps surfaceHolder)
        Sets the video playback window.

        You must call this method or setVideoSurface(ohos.agp.graphics.Surface) for video playback. Otherwise, only the audio track will be played.

        Parameters:
        surfaceHolder - Indicates the surface used for video playback.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • enableScreenOn

        public boolean enableScreenOn​(boolean screenOn)
        Keeps the screen always on during video playback.

        This method uses the SurfaceOps to keep the screen on during video playback.

        Parameters:
        screenOn - Indicates whether to keep the screen constantly on. Value true means that the screen is kept on during video playback, and false means the opposite.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • setVideoScaleType

        public boolean setVideoScaleType​(int type)
        Sets the video scaling type.
        Parameters:
        type - Indicates the way the video will be scaled. The value must be one of the following:
        • VIDEO_SCALE_TYPE_FIT
        • VIDEO_SCALE_TYPE_CROP
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • enableSingleLooping

        public boolean enableSingleLooping​(boolean looping)
        Sets the current playback to loop a single item.
        Parameters:
        looping - Indicates whether to enable playback looping. Value true means to enable playback looping, and false means to disable playback looping.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the setting is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

        Since:
        5

      • setAudioPitch

        public boolean setAudioPitch​(float audioPitch)
        Sets the pitch coefficient for the current audio.

        The audioPitch is multiplied by the original pitch to make the playback pitch of the current audio.

        Parameters:
        audioPitch - Indicates the coefficient to be multiplied. The value must be greater than 0. The default value is 1.0. You are advised to set a value within [0.3, 3]. Otherwise, the audio will be severely distorted.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the setting is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if audioPitch is less than 0.
        Since:
        5

      • getAudioPitch

        public float getAudioPitch​()
        Obtains the pitch coefficient set for the current audio.
        Returns:
        Returns the pitch coefficient set for the current audio; returns the default value 1.0 if the pitch coefficient is not set.
        Since:
        5

      • setAudioStreamType

        public boolean setAudioStreamType​(int type)
        Sets the audio type.
        Parameters:
        type - Indicates the audio type. For details, see AudioManager.AudioVolumeType
        Returns:
        Returns true if the setting is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

        Obtains the audio type.
        Returns:
        Returns the audio type.
        Since:

      • setNextPlayer

        public boolean setNextPlayer​(Player next)
        Sets the next player to start after the current player finishes playback. The next player must be set after setSource(ohos.media.common.Source) has been called, and must be prepared by the application.
        Parameters:
        next - Indicates the player to set. The next player must be different from the current one, and the pointer cannot be null.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the next player is set; returns false otherwise.

      • getStreamInfo

        public Player.StreamInfo[] getStreamInfo​()
        Obtains all media stream information contained in a media file.
        Returns:
        Returns the media stream information in a StreamInfo array whose length equals the number of streams.
        Since:
        4

      • getCurrentStream

        public int getCurrentStream​(int streamType)
        Obtains the index of a media stream (of a specified type) selected for playback.

        The index is contained in the array returned by getStreamInfo(). You can use the index for calling specifyStream(int) or unspecifyStream(int).

        Parameters:
        streamType - Indicates the stream type, which can be StreamInfo#MEDIA_STREAM_TYPE_VIDEO, StreamInfo#MEDIA_TRACK_TYPE_AUDIO, StreamInfo#MEDIA_STREAM_SUBTITLE, or StreamInfo#MEDIA_STREAM_TYPE_TIMEDTEXT.
        Returns:
        Returns the index of the stream selected for playback if the index is obtained; returns a negative integer if there is no stream of the specified streamType or the streamType value is out of the value range.
        Since:
        4

      • specifyStream

        public void specifyStream​(int streamIndex)
        Selects a media stream.

        Currently, only four types of streams are supported. StreamInfo#MEDIA_STREAM_TYPE_VIDEO and StreamInfo#MEDIA_TRACK_TYPE_AUDIO are selected by default if they are available. StreamInfo#MEDIA_STREAM_SUBTITLE and StreamInfo#MEDIA_STREAM_TYPE_TIMEDTEXT can be selected only by calling this method.

        Parameters:
        streamIndex - Indicates the index of the media stream to select. The value ranges from 0 to the total number of media streams minus 1. You can obtain the number of media streams via getStreamInfo().
        Since:
        4

      • unspecifyStream

        public void unspecifyStream​(int streamIndex)
        Unselects a selected media stream.

        Currently, this method only supports streams of the StreamInfo#MEDIA_STREAM_SUBTITLE or StreamInfo#MEDIA_STREAM_TYPE_TIMEDTEXT type.

        Parameters:
        streamIndex - Indicates the index of the media stream to unselect. The value ranges from 0 to the total number of media streams minus 1. You can obtain the number of media streams via getStreamInfo().
        Since:
        4

      • finalize

        protected void finalize​()
                 throws Throwable
        Description copied from class: Object
        Called by the garbage collector on an object when garbage collection determines that there are no more references to the object. A subclass overrides the finalize method to dispose of system resources or to perform other cleanup.

        The general contract of finalize is that it is invoked if and when the Java™ virtual machine has determined that there is no longer any means by which this object can be accessed by any thread that has not yet died, except as a result of an action taken by the finalization of some other object or class which is ready to be finalized. The finalize method may take any action, including making this object available again to other threads; the usual purpose of finalize, however, is to perform cleanup actions before the object is irrevocably discarded. For example, the finalize method for an object that represents an input/output connection might perform explicit I/O transactions to break the connection before the object is permanently discarded.

        The finalize method of class Object performs no special action; it simply returns normally. Subclasses of Object may override this definition.

        The Java programming language does not guarantee which thread will invoke the finalize method for any given object. It is guaranteed, however, that the thread that invokes finalize will not be holding any user-visible synchronization locks when finalize is invoked. If an uncaught exception is thrown by the finalize method, the exception is ignored and finalization of that object terminates.

        After the finalize method has been invoked for an object, no further action is taken until the Java virtual machine has again determined that there is no longer any means by which this object can be accessed by any thread that has not yet died, including possible actions by other objects or classes which are ready to be finalized, at which point the object may be discarded.

        The finalize method is never invoked more than once by a Java virtual machine for any given object.

        Any exception thrown by the finalize method causes the finalization of this object to be halted, but is otherwise ignored.

        Overrides:
        finalize in class Object
        Throws:
        Throwable - the Exception raised by this method
        See Also:
        WeakReference, PhantomReference
